com.yantra.api.inv

Interface manageCapacityReservation

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.INVApi, YIFApi

    public interface manageCapacityReservation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document manageCapacityReservation(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The manageCapacityReservation API can be used to reserve capacity against specified resource pool or service resource.

    • Method Detail

      • manageCapacityReservation

        org.w3c.dom.Document manageCapacityReservation(YFSEnvironment env,
                                               org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                        throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                               java.rmi.RemoteException

        The manageCapacityReservation API can be used to reserve capacity against specified resource pool or service resource. Capacity can also be reserved in secondary UOMs if the resource pool's capacity is limited in those dimensions and the resource pool does not maintain capacity at the resource level. If the resource pool does not maintain capacity in secondary dimensions, the quantity requested in the secondary dimensions will be ignored.

        The API accepts the values for extended attributes under the CapacityReservation element in the input XML. It also displays the extended attributes under the CapacityReservation element in the output XML based on the template. The extended attributes are only valid for capacity reservations. They will be lost on order creation and cannot be maintained for order or work order based consumptions.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised:

        CAPACITY_CHANGE.ON_STD_CAPACITY_FILLED
        Raised when consumption exceeds standard capacity defined for the day.
        Data Published: INV_CAPACITY_CHANGE.ON_STD_CAPACITY_FILLED.html
        Template Support: Yes
        Configuration Required for backward compatibility: No

        CAPACITY_CHANGE.ON_STD_CAPACITY_FREED
        Raised when consumption is freed and standard capacity becomes available for the day.
        Data Published: INV_CAPACITY_CHANGE.ON_STD_CAPACITY_FREED.html
        Template Support: Yes
        Configuration Required for backward compatibility: No

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
        Returns:
        For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.

        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException
        java.rmi.RemoteException
